page.title: 05Lundy South Light.
page.content: George is one of the lighthouse keepers and he showed us round.First we saw the engine room-there were 3 generators running and one in reserve. There were also 2 compressors-one in reserve.There are also batteries which will last for 24 hours in the case of a breakdown.An identifying cross-bearing radio signal is sent out every six minutes. The North Light is operated from the South and there is equipment to test the resistance in the connecting cable. Then we went up to the light.The bulb is a 1000 Watt.Above the light is the foghorn which woke us up on Monday morning.It goes off every 25 seconds. Supplies,including,diesel are now brought in by helicopter.The keepers do shifts of 28 days.George comes from Manchester. {David Hinchliffe.}
